title: Wall Street Journal reporter detained in Russia and accused of spying
description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich was detained and accused of spying in Russia. The White House has condemned his detention. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell reports.

title: Arrest warrants granted in deadly fire inside Mexico migrant center
description: Six arrest warrants have been granted in connection to a deadly fire at a government-run migrant detention center in Mexico that killed 39 men and injured 28.

title: Misinformation fuels false hopes among migrants after deadly fire in Mexico
description: False rumors about the U.S. opening its border after the deadly migrant detention fire in Mexico shows how misinformation fuels false hopes among migrants.

title: Former president Bolsonaro returns to Brazil after months-long U.S. stay
description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro arrived in Brazil after a three-month stay in Florida, seeking a new role on the political scene.

title: Wall Street Journal reporter detained in Russia on suspicion of spying for U.S.
description: Russian officials have confirmed that they have detained Evan Gershkovich, an American journalist for the Wall Street Journal, on suspicion of spying for the U.S. government. NBC News’ Kelly Cobiella breaks down what kind of work Gershkovich was doing in Russia and how the Wall Street Journal is responding to the FSB’s allegation.

title: China renews warnings as Taiwan’s president begins U.S. visit to shore up support
description: Taiwan’s president is beginning a swing through the United States and Central America, a visit aimed at showing that her self-ruled island has allies as it faces a rising threat from China.

title: Philippine ferry fire kills 31 people and leaves at least 7 missing
description: A fire broke out on a ferry in the southern Philippines and raged overnight for eight hours, killing at least 31 of the approximately 250 passengers and crew, officials said Thursday.

title: Pope Francis 'improving' in hospital after quiet night, Vatican says
description: Pope Francis is “progressively improving” after he spent the night in a Rome hospital where he was diagnosed with a respiratory infection, the Vatican said Thursday.

title: Pope Francis ‘rested well’ in overnight hospital stay, Vatican says
description: The Vatican says Pope Francis spend the night in a Rome hospital after he was admitted on Wednesday with breathing difficulties, adding that the 86-year-old “rested well” and has “resumed work.” NBC News’ Claudio Lavanga reports from Rome.

title: Watch: Four cheetah cubs born in India after pioneering restoration program
description: Siyaya, a three-year-old cheetah who was one of eight cats relocated from Namibia to India's Kuno National Park, has given birth to four cubs. It was the culmination of a 13-year effort to restore a species that vanished from India 70 years ago.

title: Taiwanese president receives enthusiastic welcome in New York City
description: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen, who is on a swing through the U.S. and Central America to bolster support for her self-ruled island, received a warm welcome from overseas Taiwanese nationals as she arrived for a formal dinner in New York City.

title: Pope Francis to spend several days in hospital
description:
Pope Francis was admitted to a Rome hospital after complaining of breathing difficulties in recent days, the Vatican said Wednesday. Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said medical checks had been carried out on the pontiff at the Gemelli hospital, where Francis underwent surgery in 2021.
NBC News' Claudio Lavanga reports from Rome.
